comments.value: Specifically for ticketing pre-sign up, but also for Vancouver 2012 and other eventualities. Date is provisional.

H Morag,

The new emergency homepage may be part of this (addressed in a separate ticket)

But are you commissioning a light weight homepage for ticketing (ie. no login links and with the main focus being a link to Ticketmaster and the final confirmation page on Ticketmaster having a link back to the normal homepage) or do you just want all traffic re-directed direct to the lOndon2102 page on Ticketmaster for the launch?

Actually more to the point, are you expecting anything of us re. this ticket and if so what ;-) even if it's just 'can you make suggestions'

thanks

Jamie

Hi Jamie

 

A timely email! We have indeed commissioned a lightweight splash page
for Ticketing launch, with exactly the contents you describe.

 

I can send you an early version of this - we are using it to do some
load tests with on the BT servers.

 

The user journey will be as follows:

 

Most marketing will take people directly to Ticketmaster at the URL
tickets.london2012.com. We will redirect london2012.com/tickets to
Ticketmaster too but we want to keep people off our infrastructure as
much as possible.

 

People who come to our home page through search will follow the links on
the splash page onto Ticketmaster or into our site.

 

When our splash page is finalised we will send it to you and will need
you to put it live at the appointed time on the day (towards end of
March). We would also be likely to need your help if we get too much
traffic and have to put up a 'come back later' page.

 

Does that sound okay?

________________________________
Have renamed this from: "Contingency plan for increased traffic". Pushed the date to March 31st and set as pending, i.e. awaiting arrival of splash page
Done. See http://postcms.zendesk.com/tickets/708

subject: Splash page for ticketing launch
description: Specifically for ticketing pre-sign up, but also for Vancouver 2012 and other eventualities. Date is provisional.

comments.value: Hello, the short URL /tickets currently points to our splash page, but I would like it to point to wwww.tickets.london2012.com. I think this short URL was hard coded, as I can't see it in the URL administration tool to update it. Can you advise what I need to do to create the right redirect? thanks!

Hi Morag,

I couldn't see an existing short url so have just updated it via the 
short url tool for you
http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/admin/shorturls/

Jamie

Oh, great - thank you. I didn't want to just go in and create a new
short URL there in case there was something set up elsewhere which would
conflict with it. But that's great!

 

________________________________

subject: /tickets short URL
description: Hello, the short URL /tickets currently points to our splash page, but I would like it to point to wwww.tickets.london2012.com. comments.value: I'm not completely sure this is an issue related to our web site, but users on IE7 are reporting that if they do Print Preview on pages on our website (in this instance, the Olympic Stadium page) they get a blank screen and a page tally at the bottom which runs to hundreds. When I click Print Preview in IE8 it is absolutely fine however. Could there be a problem with printing our website pages in some browsers? Or do you think it is a user-related problem?
Janos, could you take a quick look at this and let Morag know if you can replicate the behaviour in IE7.

Hmm, nice ie7 bug. I'll copy this here for historians: http://www.stemkoski.com/soltution-for-the-internet-explorer-7-endless-printing-bug/

Should be fixed now.
Many thanks for that.

Splendid! Well detected, Janos. I was convinced this was a classic
PICNIC (Problem In Chair, Not In Computer)

 

Thanks!

________________________________

subject: Print preview issue
description: I'm not completely sure this is an issue related to our web site, but users on IE7 are reporting that if they do Print Preview on pages on our website (in this instance, the Olympic Stadium page) they get a blank screen and a page tally at the bottom which runs to hundreds. When I click Print Preview in IE8 it is absolutely fine however. Could there be a problem with printing our website pages in some browsers? Or do you think it is a user-related problem?

Hi Liz,
I have identified 85 images that don't have any alt text.
I've (hopefully helpfully) collected them on the following page:
  http://london2012dev.kitsite.com/images.php
I will send you the username/password separately, in case you don't have it.
Please note, you can click on any of these images in order to open them in the CMS, from where you can edit the alt text.
Once this is done, this will - I believe - mean that all of the (known) alt text issues are fixed.
I hope this is helpful.
Kieran

That's fantastic! Thank you.

 

Liz Goulding

New Media Producer

London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games

Direct line: +44 (0) 203 2012 297

Switchboard: +44 (0) 203 2012 000

www.london2012.com  

www.twitter.com/london2012 

________________________________

It should work ok though, so any such future ticket should not be billable.

thanks!

comments.value:
We need to republish the site in a way that minimises disruption in order to be ready to put the ticketing nav live for launch on Monday (as well as to be able to put live other work that is completed).

See:
http://postcms.zendesk.com/tickets/664
http://postcms.zendesk.com/tickets/645

You will need to co-ordinate with Lars who will be working on the new code this week, but my guess is that we will want to have the site re-published before Monday morning, but after Lars has made necessary changes to the navigation.
see http://postcms.zendesk.com/tickets/706

This was all completed yesterday, correct?

 

Liz Goulding

New Media Producer

London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games

Direct line: +44 (0) 203 2012 297

Switchboard: +44 (0) 203 2012 000

www.london2012.com  

www.twitter.com/london2012 

________________________________

All completed. And as a bonus, Kieran has spotted an optimization that should make it quicker next time. Also, we published everything as "low priority", so any pages published independently should not have been affected (unlike last time).

Excellent! Let's close this, then.

 

Liz Goulding

New Media Producer

London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games

Direct line: +44 (0) 203 2012 297

Switchboard: +44 (0) 203 2012 000

www.london2012.com  

www.twitter.com/london2012 

________________________________
hm.  why is this .3 of a day?  sorry for being pedantic, but we can't really afford to pay for republishing the site, every time we republish it?

The time was largely spent writing a procedure that we can follow in the future.
The next time we do it (tomorrow, I believe) it will more-or-less just be a matter of "pressing a button". i.e. all other things being equal, next time it will be zero days.
(P.S. no apology due!)

In general it's a good thing to do such things...but you didn't tell us
you were doing it! After you had already recorded your time, you said, 

"And as a bonus, Kieran has spotted an optimization that should make it
quicker next time." I like bonuses...just not ones that have already
been decided for me!

 

Liz Goulding

New Media Producer

London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games

Direct line: +44 (0) 203 2012 297

Switchboard: +44 (0) 203 2012 000

www.london2012.com  

www.twitter.com/london2012 

________________________________

Sorry, this should have been made clearer. There are two different things being talked about here.

1. "Republishing the site" is a task which arises relatively often. Upon this occasion, I spent a small amount of extra time developing a routine that we can run on the next occasion which will result in our billable time being zero. This, I have billed for.

2. The "optimization" that Danny mentioned was not technically related to this ticket, and - as such - is probably confusing matters. What happened was that I noticed that some pages were slow to publish (Events pages, fwiw) and spent some time speeding them up (massively; i.e. from about 10 sec each to about 1 sec each). This led to the actual process of publication being much quicker. This I did NOT bill for (as - you're right - it was neither requested nor authorized).

I hope this makes sense?
Kieran

Let's close this!

 

Liz Goulding

New Media Producer

London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games

Direct line: +44 (0) 203 2012 297

Switchboard: +44 (0) 203 2012 000

www.london2012.com  

www.twitter.com/london2012 

________________________________
Marking as authorized, but, Liz, your comments are noted and we agree that we need to be more careful about getting anything but the smallest bits of work (<0.1  day?) signed off before proceeding.

comments.value:
On sports (and paralympic sports) pages there are 'venue' boxes in the top right, that say the name of the venue.  We want to change this to say 'Venue: ' before the name.  So right now where it says, 'Aquatics Centre' it would say, 'Venue: Aquatics centre'.  For some sports, it's not at all clear why there are these random buildings on the top of the pages!

This comes under feedback from the usability testing - which I *think* we agreed would go towards the ODA. Danny, can you confirm if i'm remembering properly?

Quote please?

Date proposed as 16 March.

So basically prefixing the name with 'Venue:"

The danger is that will break almost all titles over two lines, no?

Do you still want us to do it?

Well, the 2 line thing is a bit of a bummer, but I can't think of
another way to do it so it's clear what those things actually *are*. Do
you guys have any inspired ideas?

 

Liz Goulding

New Media Producer

London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games

Direct line: +44 (0) 203 2012 297

Switchboard: +44 (0) 203 2012 000

www.london2012.com  

www.twitter.com/london2012 

________________________________

Hi Liz,

Oh that's what they are, I always thought they were photos of a rather fine assortment of steel fruit bowls !!

Have updated do you want to check you happy, if you are we can republish all the sports page en-mass for you.   
http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/preview/games/olympic-sports/aquatics-diving.php

Have attached screengrab of a version where the 'Venue:' is outside of the link (personally I prefer it all in Blue)

Jamie

Cool - thanks. Looks good! 

 

Liz Goulding

New Media Producer

London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games

Direct line: +44 (0) 203 2012 297

Switchboard: +44 (0) 203 2012 000

www.london2012.com  

www.twitter.com/london2012

Turns out they've changed the default button action in IE8. We have a fix ready to go live in our next deployment.
Michael, can you confirm whether or not you've deployed this patch yourself or whether you were waiting for Kieran to deploy a bundle?

subject: IE 8 - searching for a picture that has already been imported
description:
Doesn't seem to work. I entered my search term (paralympic sport tv),
hit enter, and the lightbox closed. There were no results (even though
there is definitely an image there) and no image appeared in the image
box.
